relatedanime.anime: Sket Dance: Imouto no Nayami ni Nayamu Ani ni Nayamu Imouto to Sono Nakama-tachi

recommendations.recommendation: I follow the sket dance manga every week and i like it very much. But the anime somehow feels inferior. No idea if its the choice of voice actors or the way the anime is executed. But it is still more enjoyable than most plotless fanservice anime every season.

This show has a similar concept to Gintama, but the way it`s executed is pretty different. The humor is pretty good most of the time, but it also has a bad habit of falling flat in an awkward "this is too painful to laugh at" kind of way. If you`re unsure of whether you want to watch this or not, I`d suggest skipping to episode 18 to see an average view of what you`ll be getting most of the time, and then skip to episodes 24 and 25 so you can get an idea of how the show is like when it`s being serious. It`s not all gags and happy fun time. Overall you can expect laughs, romance, and tears as the show deals with high school life and some rather surprisingly dark themes from time to time.

I personally don`t think it`s an averege anime. It`s refreshing,the characters are unique, the plot is simple but catchy, and if u want a good laugh and smile almost episode, this is your anime to watch. This anime is surely in my top 10. Enjoy, u will not waste your time, trust me!!!
A Gintama in a school setting minus the aliens, despite this shows lack of flashy fight scenes it still pulled it off, I for one recommend this anime, hoping for a 2nd season :D

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr22072 [Shinohara Kenta]`s Sket Dance school comedy manga serialised in http://anidb.net/cr5372 [Weekly Shounen Jump]. The Sket Team is a school club whose self-proclaimed mission is to help people. It`s members are http://anidb.net/ch25481 [Bossun], the leader; http://anidb.net/ch25480 [Himeko], the blond girl with a kansai-accent; and bespectacled http://anidb.net/ch25479 [Switch], intellectual otaku. No matter what your problem may be, they will do their best to help you. On paper, this sounds cool but the reality is that they usually just laze away in their clubroom. The occasional requests that they do receive are usually trivial matters such as searching for lost objects. ~ translated and adapted from official site by Cranston

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: detective
tag.description: A detective is an investigator, generally either a member of a law enforcement agency or as an individual working in the capacity of private investigators, tasked with solving crimes and other mysteries, such as disappearances, by examining and evaluating clues and records in order to solve the mystery; for a crime, this would mean uncovering the criminal`s identity and/or whereabouts. In some police systems, a detective position is achieved by passing a written test after a person completes the requirements for being a police officer; in others, detectives are college graduates who join directly from civilian life without first serving as uniformed officers. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: transfer student
tag.description: A transfer student is a student who changes from one institution or course to another at the same level. Their arrival, when not at the beginning of the school year, tends to cause a stir.

tag.name: twin -- TO BE DELETED
tag.description: This tag is meant to be purged in the short term. Please DO NOT assign it to any further characters; add the appropriate char-char relations to them instead.

tag.name: high school
tag.description: A secondary school that usually contains grades 10 through 12 in Japan, or 9 through 12 in America.

tag.name: delinquent
tag.description: Delinquents - Every school has them, but not all anime with school setting make delinquents a central topic. There are several versions of these delinquents, though some are grounded on a misunderstanding: * The student with a really bad image and attitude, based on his real criminal actions outside of the school and is even feared by teachers. * The primitive "class bully" that pushes around ("clobbers") his classmates for no apparent reason, possibly extorting lunch money. * The student with an sinister complexion or "evil eye", but is actually a "good" student (unfoundedly feared character). * The rebellious student, who does not care for studying, but is otherwise docile. Called a "delinquent" as a joke.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: absurdist humour
tag.description: Surreal humour, also known as absurdist humour, is a form of humour predicated on deliberate violations of causal reasoning, producing events and behaviours that are obviously illogical. Constructions of surreal humour tend to involve bizarre juxtapositions, non-sequiturs, irrational or absurd situations, and expressions of nonsense. The humour arises from a subversion of audience`s expectations, so that amusement is founded on unpredictability, separate from a logical analysis of the situation. Its appeal stems from the fact that the situation described is exceedingly ridiculous or unlikely. On an analytical level, all jokes contain a certain amount of incongruity, but while regular jokes carry an incongruity that the audience accepts as compatible with expectations, absurd jokes are characterized by a disproportionate amount of it, with the punch line delivering a situation incompatible with the world as we know it and failing to resolve the matter in the audience`s eyes. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: school clubs
tag.description: Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs. As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: parental abandonment
tag.description: In Japan it is a common custom for parents to leave their children alone at home and embark on a lifelong trip around the world once they hit the tender age of 14, sometimes even earlier. Of course this is done because the parents believe their children are independent enough to get their act together. But little do they know about the small secrets their offspring has, such as a childhood fiancé(e) or even a forbidden incestuous love between their (often not-blood-related) children. Of course aside from having a huge house, financial support is provided as well. Usually through the means of MAGICAL MONEY. In rare cases the parents actually die (shortly) before embarking on their world-trip, which is self-evidently used as an important plot device in the development of the child.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: emotions awaken superpowers
tag.description: During an extreme emotional state — rage, love, hate, angst, sadness, compassion — something inside the character will "click" that will increase greatly his/her power or a new superpower awakes, that surpasses anything achieved by him/her until then.

tag.name: wordplay
tag.description: The characters play with words. E.g. purposely or accidentally use similar-sounding but wrongly applied words in the Japanese original, leading to supposedly funny misunderstandings and confusion.

tag.name: late for school
tag.description: A common device for a series opening or Establishing Character Moment. Things begin in a frantic rush which usually results in taking short cuts, such as eating breakfast on the run. The classic image is of someone running down the street with a slice of toast hanging out of their mouth, dragging their backpack with one hand while trying to put on their jacket or sweater one-handed with the other, bumping into important people in a manner that gets the plot started. Basically, they`re never on time for school. While some are Heavy Sleepers, it would appear that they may have simply set their alarm clocks so as to give them insufficient time to get to class. Source: TVTrope

tag.name: heart-warming
tag.description: The story and its characters give off good vibes — includes elevated feelings of affection such as tenderness, sympathy and love, all in one package. The kind of anime which leaves you with a warm feeling inside and you can not stop smiling while watching it.

tag.name: age change
tag.description: Because who wouldn`t like to be young/old again.

tag.name: computer geek
tag.description: A person (mostly male), who is obsessed with computers.

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Jump
tag.description: The Weekly Shounen Jump is a Japanese manga magazine released on a weekly basis. Its main target audience consists of young males and it features several manga titles. The magazine was created by http://anidb.net/cr780 [Shueisha] in July, 1968, and was originally only called Shounen Jump, because it was not published every week at the time. A number of very famous shounen manga were or are published in it, such as http://anidb.net/a386 [Hokuto no Ken], http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], http://anidb.net/a942 [City Hunter], http://anidb.net/a826 [Saint Seiya], http://anidb.net/a590 [Slam Dunk], http://anidb.net/a312 [Yuu Yuu Hakushou], http://anidb.net/a69 [One Piece], http://anidb.net/a239 [Naruto], http://anidb.net/a2369 [Bleach], http://anidb.net/a4563 [Death Note], http://anidb.net/a3468 [Gintama], to name a few of the most well-known.

tag.name: product placement
tag.description: Otherwise known as a "plug" or "writing commercials right into a show". The practice of prominently displaying or talking about a recognizable product in a program, in exchange for some consideration from the manufacturer, usually monetary. (Source: TV Tropes) Particularly notorious example, Pizza Hut for the involvement with Code Geass, Darker than Black and other series.

tag.name: catchphrase
tag.description: A catchphrase is a sound, word or phrase commonly used by a person. That may be simply out of habit, or in an attempt to deliver some form of image, like that of cuteness. In fiction, characters often use catchphrases as a way to deliver specific personality traits. Examples include Otohime Mutsumi`s "ara ara" in Love Hina, Yang Wenli`s "yare yare" in Legend of the Galactic Heroes, Misuzu`s "gao" in AIR, Sakura`s "hoe" in Card Captor Sakura, Suiseiseki`s "desu" in Rozen Maiden, and Ayu`s "uguu" in Kanon (as well as several other characters in the same show).

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

character.name: Sakata Gintoki
character.description: Sakata Gintoki is the main character of the story. He has naturally permed hair, which he blames for his lack of a love-life. He rides a motor scooter and wields a bokuto, which has "Lake Touya" inscribed on it. His job, as is written on his business card, is a "free-lancer", meaning he`ll take any job for nearly any price. He enjoys reading http://anidb.net/cr5372 [Shounen Jump] comics and he has a sweet tooth and will go into crazed combat if he does not have his sweets (he has glycosuria). In the past, he was a Joui (someone who attempted to overthrow Amanto to protect the government). The reason Gintoki does not join http://anidb.net/ch1165 [Katsura Kotarou] again to fight the aliens is that he does not like to fight alongside "gloomy terrorists".

character.name: Shimura Shinpachi
character.description: Shinpachi Shimura works under Gintoki to learn the ways of the samurai. He used to stay at his family`s doujo. However, it seems more like he`s just trying to help Gintoki pay the rent than to learn. Shinpachi is the captain of the "Otsu`s Imperial Guard," a pop-singer`s fan club, and takes his role seriously. Other members of the fan club treat him with utmost respect, something he isn`t treated with usually.

character.name: Kagura
character.description: Although she appears to be a normal, cute, human girl in Chinese-style clothing, she actually belongs to the Yato Clan, one of the strongest and most bloodthirsty of the Amanto races, although Kagura rejects that part of herself. The Yato are said to have "transparent" (snow-white) skin that is highly sensitive to sunlight, so Kagura carries a purple parasol at all times. The parasol is also the Yato clan`s weapon of choice; Kagura`s is bulletproof and fires bullets from its tip. Because of her Yato blood, she is super-strong and can stop a speeding motorscooter with one hand. Although stronger than most humans, she cannot control her strength perfectly. Her super-human strength makes her extremely bad with pets. Most of her pets, with the exception of Sadaharu, have met with an untimely demise by her hands.

character.name: Miyanaga Saki
character.description: Miyanaga Saki is a high school freshman and is the main heroine of the story. She initially joins the Mahjong Club so she can reach Nationals to see her sister, a top-ranked mahjong player. She is notorious for her ability to score zero points every round. Her skill primarily comes from her ability to read her opponents and their tiles to see the flow of the game. At the mahjong tournament, she is made the captain of the team.

character.name: Haramura Nodoka
character.description: Haramura Nodoka is a high school freshman who attends the same school as Saki and is a member of the Mahjong Club. She was the previous year`s National Middle School Individual Champion. Her skill, in comparison to Saki`s, comes from practicing via online mahjong. At the mahjong tournament, she is the vice-captain of the team. Her nickname is "Nodocchi" after her play style, quickly and efficiently racking up points as quickly as possible.

character.name: Ikeda Kana
character.description: Ikeda Kana is a second year student at Kazekoshi Girls` High School. Source: Saki Wikia

character.name: Nakano Azusa
character.description: Nakano Azusa is a new student who joins the http://anidb.net/ch6218 [light music club], a self-proclaimed novice guitarist who has been playing the guitar since the fourth grade and whose parents are working in a jazz band. She often finds herself bewildered by the tea parties and cosplaying aspects of the club, when she would rather just practice, although she also has a weakness for cakes. She could be described in part as a tsundere. Furthermore she is referred to as "Azunyan" by Yui and the others since the day she wore a pair of fake catears (nekomimi).

character.name: Touyoko Momoko
character.description: Momoko is Yumi`s friend, and a high school first year student. She has a lacking presence, and is often ignored by her friends despite her efforts to gain attention; as such, she soon gave up on building relationships with other people. After a match through LAN mahjong, Yumi acknowledges Momoko`s skills and finds her; the two become friends afterwards. Her mahjong playing ability comes when she augments her negative presence into an advantageous stealth state, causing her opponents to miss her moves.

character.name: Switch
character.description: Switch is the brains and secretary to the Sket-Dan. He is an otaku (no matter how many times he denies it) that has information about everyone in Kaimei-high. Switch appears to be the most serious of the group but his fooling around says other wise. He also has a strong belief in science which is shown through his rivalry against occult lover, Yuuki Reiko. The most unique thing about Switch is that he talks through a computer.

character.name: Himeko
character.description: Himeko is the violent "yankee"-girl with a soft spot for cute things. She is the fighter/ brawn to the Sket-Dan. In her past she was called "Legendary Yankee Onihime" which became a symbol of "power and fear". Himeko seems to now have "calmed down" from her days of being the Onihime and has become the second-chief to the Sket-Dan.

character.name: Bossun
character.description: The team leader, an expert marksman and artist whose usually erratic personality is replaced with a brilliant deductive mindset by ceremonially donning goggles in a process called `Connecting`—this allows him to make eerily accurate inferences by concentrating entirely on absolutely all the available evidence, to the extent of accurately recalling background noise. He enjoys the sense of adventure he receives from helping others for its own sake, but can become very emotionally involved with more serious cases to the extent of verbally abusing those he sees to be betraying their friends. Despite Bossun`s deceptively sharp acumen, he is notably socially awkward around attractive women. He frequently breaks the Fourth Wall; he also vocally guards his position as the protagonist of the series when sidelined. However, when he won the Character Popularity contest (which had a whole chapter based around it), he was extremely humble about it. On his fifteenth birthday, he discovered that he was not related to his mother, Akane, and his sister, Rumi. His actual parents were Akane`s best friends, Ryousuke and Haru. When Bossun was about to be born, his parents were involved in car accidents. His father died while saving a child, and his mother died from giving birth. He ran away from home and wandered around aimlessly. After meeting Taisuke Mishima, the child who his father had saved, Bossun received the present that Ryousuke had meant to give to Haru after the birth. Bossun read the letters, saying about how he should help other people. However, in anger, he flung down the letters and claimed that he would only live for himself. After watching a student his age be bullied (it was actually Tsubaki, but he had longer hair and glasses then, so they didn`t recognise each other after they met again), he discovered that he had truly inherited his parents` blood because he couldn`t resist helping other people. He later on returned to Akane and Rumi, and continued to live with them. Bossun continued to believe that he was alone in the world, before the doctor who had helped deliver him came to him on his birthday and told him that he had a younger twin brother. As a result, he realised that his brother was actually Tsubaki Sasuke from the Disciplinary Committee. Bossun felt deep down that he had already known because everybody kept saying that they were similar. Despite knowing that they were brothers, both Tsubaki and Bossun continue to have an awkward rivalry with each other, often breaking in to fights, but slowly getting closer, as brothers should. He also has inherited some behaviour from Akane having shown that when ever she yells at Bossun at some point she would end up saying "dummy" repeatedly. He has shown a great assortment of talents, such as being able to draw as good as a mangaka, able to make origami be extremely life like, and being excellent at riddles, the second best in the school.

character.name: Chuuma Tetsuji
character.description: The little-seen and inhumanly apathetic "Club Supervisor" of the Sket-dan spends most of his time in his lab instead of minding them, where his only gift seems to be for creating dangerous and unstable explosive devices. Despite this he has create potions of science fiction effect, such as a youth potion and potions able to change a person`s personality,. As his token support is prerequisite to Sket-dan`s existence, he holds the threat of its withdrawal over the members` heads when he wishes to coerce them into some unreasonable `favour`.

character.name: Unyuu Mimori
character.description: The Treasurer of the Student Council. She`s the wealthy granddaughter of the Unyuu Group`s leader. She is competent enough to know how to allocate hidden funds for the Student Council, but this is countered by her desires to spend frivolously. She believes money is a means to all ends, from love confessions to winning competitions. Despite this, she considers herself an advocate of proper conduct, and even lectures Tsubaki for his uncivilised actions. Outside of her financial duties, she provides refreshments and first aid supplies to the other Student Council members.

character.name: Yagi Kaoru
character.description: Yagi Kaoru is a member of the broadcasting club best known for her ability to maintain a straight face during any situation. Previously, Yoshimura framed her as a result of her finding a DVD of test answers he had recorded, but the Sket Dan investigated and resolved her of all charges. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Kibitsu Momoka
character.description: She`s the leader of the yankee girls, and claims herself as the "Onihime". She told her three followers to bring Himeko to the park near a train station to beat her up. She later then found out that the legendary "Onihime" was Himeko herself. After finding the truth, she became Himeko`s follower and would only listen to her. Later on, she becomes a famous voice actor.

character.name: Agata Soujirou
character.description: President of the Student Council and a third year student. A very charismatic, laid-back individual, who seemingly does nothing as President. He entrusts most responsibilities to the Vice President, Tsubaki Sasuke. His IQ is around 160 His ability to read and understand people is used to manipulate them to do what he wants, such as motivating Bossun into competing with him seriously. This same ability is why he has the complete loyalty of Student Council members, Sasuke and Daisy. His performance in the Gachinko Vivage Battle`s "Pixie Garden" match with Bossun shows that he is a good strategist, who learns quickly, and is adept at lying. Despite his ruthlessness, and professions that he isn`t a nice guy, he`s against cheating to win. He has a tendency to forget things he`s said, such as the bet he pretended to make with Bossun to get him fired up. He is very lazy, known to sleep in the council`s classroom.

character.name: Saotome Roman
character.description: She`s a girl who likes manga and from time to time she can be a `character` in a manga. She copies the actions of the girls in manga, and she is pretty bad in drawing. She was looking for her `Prince` which led her Sket dan asking them to help her find her prince. It turned out that her prince was Yusuke.

character.name: Tsubaki Sasuke
character.description: The Vice President of the Student Council, who takes his responsibilities very seriously, even over zealously, willing to punch a hole in a wall and injure himself to get his point across. He believes that the Sket-dan is useless and should be abolished, leading to conflicts with Bossun. The two consider each other rivals and his desire to defeat Bossun and the Sket-dan motivate him to do things he wouldn`t otherwise do. He is a skilled fighter, and the boxing club at their school wanted him on their team. He also researches his opponents weaknesses and uses them to his advantage. He is very similar to Bossun, as many other people had noted. It was later revealed that Tsubaki and Bossun are twin brothers, separated from birth. After the discovery, Tsubaki and Bossun`s relationship became even more awkward, but they slowly began to grow closer, with Bossun even inviting Tsubaki over for dinner to meet Akane and Rumi. Akane noted that while Bossun looked more like his father, Ryousuke, Tsubaki looked more like his mother, Haru.

character.name: Shinba Michiru
character.description: A Student Council Member responsible for General Affairs, and a Third-year Student. He is a narcissist, who loves having his picture taken. He is popular with girls, and also has a very devoted fan club called the "Shinbals". He is an extremely good chef, considered "exceptional even among professionals." Michiru often plays the straight man opposite the quirks of the other student council and is also one of the few people who understands that Soujirou has a manipulative side.

character.name: Asahina Kikuno
character.description: The Secretary of the Student Council, nicknamed "Daisy-chan." She is a Second-year student, who will do whatever Soujirou tells her to do, from participating in the Gachinko Vivage Battle Tournament to going undercover on a Student Council Operation to catch a ring of blackmailers. She speaks harshly, and insults people on purpose, often saying things like "Drown in a gutter and die", or "Drown, die, revive, and die again." She has good aim, and relentlessly attacks without hesitation. While she seems calm and composed on the outside, she is quick to judge others, and thus, underestimate them. She doesn`t handle failure very well, and will console herself by cuddling stuffed animals. She especially dislikes bothering other people, so she rarely asks for help.

character.name: Yuuki Reiko
character.description: Reiko Yuuki is a woman with a high degree of knowledge concerning curses, fortune telling and all things related to the Occult. This fascination of hers often leads her to conflict with Switch, who only is willing to accept things based in scientific fact. In spite of their natural rivalry and mutual animosity, however, Yuuki actually gets along with Switch quite well (and vice versa).

character.name: Takahashi Chiaki
character.description: Takahashi Chiaki, usually called Captain, is the captain of Kaimei High School`s softball team and Himeko`s first friend in Kaimei High School.

character.name: Seitokai Shikkoubu
character.description: The rivals of the Sket-dan, who uphold school rules and handle administrative duties, like the creation and funding of clubs. Within the Sket Dance world, there is a manga series about them, running in Shounen Jump, and a tie-in game on Vivage City, a mobile phone game company.

character.name: Fujisaki Rumi
character.description: Fujisaki Rumi is Bossun`s foster sister. Though she frequently treats him like her personal servant, she also genuinely cares for him. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Saburou
character.description: Saburou is a student at Kaimei High School who is always seen together with Jougasaki.

character.name: Fujisaki Akane
character.description: Fujisaki Akane is Bossun`s foster mother. She was close friends with his biological parents, Haru and Ryousuke and kept the truth about them from Bossun until he figured things out on his 15th birthday. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Mixer
character.description: The mixer at the sound studio, voiced by the director and sound director of Sket Dance, Kawaguchi Keiichirou.

character.name: Watanabe Kantoku
character.description: Watanabe Shin`ichi self-insert.

character.name: Hinohara Enta
character.description: Hinohara Enta is a manga artist. His name is a play on the name of Sket Dance`s mangaka Shinohara Kenta and his appearance is modelled after the god of manga, Tezuka Osamu.

character.name: Bossun
character.description: Bossun turns into a three-year-old child in episode nine after accidentally drinking an experiment by Chuuma Tetsuji.

character.name: Yoshimura
character.description: Yoshimura is the homeroom teacher of 2-E and the advisor of the Broadcasting Club.

character.name: Shironuma Sawako
character.description: Himeko plays the role of Shironuma Sawako in a drama Sket Dance filmed. The title of the drama is Kimi ni Todokahen nen (It Didn`t Reach You), a parody of the manga/anime series http://anidb.net/a6466 [Kimi ni Todoke].

character.name: Kazeoso-kun
character.description: Bossun plays the role of Kazeoso-kun in a drama Sket Dance filmed. The title of the drama is Kimi ni Todokahen nen (It Didn`t Reach You), a parody of the manga/anime series http://anidb.net/a6466 [Kimi ni Todoke].

character.name: Yoshida-san
character.description: Switch plays the role of Yoshida-san in a drama Sket Dance filmed. The title of the drama is Kimi ni Todokahen nen (It Didn`t Reach You), a parody of the manga/anime series http://anidb.net/a6466 [Kimi ni Todoke].

character.name: Yano-san
character.description: Switch plays the role of Yano-san in a drama Sket Dance filmed. The title of the drama is Kimi ni Todokahen nen (It Didn`t Reach You), a parody of the manga/anime series http://anidb.net/a6466 [Kimi ni Todoke].

character.name: Itou Kumi
character.description: Itou Kumi is a student at Kaimei High School and the class representative for Class 2-C. She is voted Class 2-C`s "Number 1 Miss Sexy".

character.name: Sket-dan
character.description: The group the trio formed after their original groups fell apart

character.name: Sugisaki Ayano
character.description: Sugisaki Ayano is a student at Kaimei High School and a genius violinist. As a child she was an introvert, but upon seeing a violin performance on TV was taken by a desire to play the instrument and soon enrolled in lessons. She has very little confidence in her own abilities, resulting in her being hesitant about going abroad to study music in Germany. Though she originally decided not to, the Sket Dan`s performance at the Kaimei Rock Festival gave her the courage to go through with it.

character.name: Karamatsu Genzaburou
character.description: Karamatsu Genzaburou is the principal of Kaimei High School.

character.name: Sacchin
character.description: Sacchin is a friend of Tomoko`s who was originally going to play keyboard for Yabasawa`s band in the Kaimei Rock Festival.

character.name: Igarashi Seiji
character.description: Igarashi Seiji is a student at Kaimei High School who was originally going to play lead guitar for Bossun`s band at the Kaimei Rock Festival. He later asks the Sket Dan for help with a group blind date, where it is revealed that he likes Tomoko.

character.name: Shimizu Yoshie
character.description: Shimizu Yoshie is a student at Kaimei High School who was going to play drums in Yabasawa`s band for the Kaimei Rock Festival, until all of the band members fell sick. She was also mentioned when Switch was gathering info on the Ghost Incinerator incident. In the anime, she later asks the Sket Dan for help in getting a date online.

character.name: Kumiko
character.description: A character from Roman`s manga.

character.name: Nikaidou Sara
character.description: A character from Roman`s manga.

character.name: Takuya
character.description: A character from Roman`s manga.

character.name: Tomoko
character.description: Tomoko is a student at Kaimei High School who has been dating Seiji since confessing to him during a group blind date. She is friends with Sacchin, who she sat next to during the school trip bus ride.

character.name: 2-C
character.description: 2-C is the class the Sket Dan and most of the other appearing characters are in.

character.name: Liberty Maji
character.description: Liberty Maji is the main character of the mahou shoujo series Mahou no Yankee Liberty Maji, which is produced by the same studio that does Futari wa Nervous!. She is voiced by http://anidb.net/ch27847 [Momoka].

character.name: Takashi
character.description: Takashi is a student at Kaimei High School and the love interest of Yosshii.

character.name: Takemitsu Funzou
character.description: Takemitsu Funzou is Shinzou and Shinpei`s father. Though an actor, he generally only has roles as an extra in period dramas. He taught Shinzou the Takemitsu-style of sword techniques.

character.name: Takemitsu Shinpei
character.description: Takemitsu Shinpei is Shinzou`s little brother who also attends Kaimei High School as a freshman in Class 1-D.

character.name: Yamauchi Sawa
character.description: Yamauchi Sawa is Switch and Masafumi`s childhood friend. She has a tendency to mix up words, much like Remi, and since middle school was popular with boys. She and Switch held feelings for each other, but were ultimately unable to openly admit them until it was too late. When they were children, Switch asked her whether she would rather marry him or his brother; it is implied that she chose Switch. During her freshman year of high school, she discovered a boy was stalking her. Soon after, when she received a death threat in the mail, she went to the Usui brothers for advice. As a result of their suggestions, she decided to go buy some self-protection equipment. Switch, who had been acting strangely, opted not to go and instead she went with Masafumi. Some time after they went out, they encountered Sawa`s supposed friend Yukino - who stabbed Masafumi in the chest. As a result of a conversation with Switch, Yukino believed Masafumi was Sawa`s boyfriend and acted out of revenge for her own ex-boyfriend dumping her in favor of pursuing Sawa. Shortly after Masafumi`s death and his brother`s subsequent downward spiral, Sawa and her family moved. She couldn`t remain in the same town any longer, as it held too many memories and she kept seeing Masafumi wherever she went. Source: Sket Dance Wiki

character.name: Usui Kazuyoshi
character.description: Usui Kazuyoshi (Switch) before he took over his brother`s appearance and nickname as a memento.

character.name: Usui Masafumi
character.description: Usui Masafumi was Switch`s brother and the original source of the "Switch" nickname. A year younger than his brother, he was brilliant with computers and possessed a very scientific mind. He created the speech synthesis software that Switch always uses, though he hadn`t perfected it prior to his death. He was killed by Yukino, who mistakenly believed that he and Sawa were dating. As Yukino`s former boyfriend had left her in part because he fell for Sawa, she intended to make Sawa suffer as she had and thus stabbed Sawa`s supposed-boyfriend Masafumi in the chest.

character.name: Usui Haha
character.description: Switch`s mother.

character.name: Hirai Yukino
character.description: Hirai Yukino first appears as Sawa`s friend. In reality that is only an act. She is actually Mikami Shinji`s former girlfriend. As he had left her in part because he fell for Sawa, she intended to make Sawa suffer as she had and thus stabbed Sawa`s supposed-boyfriend Masafumi in the chest.

character.name: Mikami Shinji
character.description: Mikami Shinji is Yukino`s former boyfriend.

character.name: Keiji
character.description: The police officer in charge of Masafumi`s murder.

character.name: Kaimei Gakuen
character.description: Kaimei Gakuen is the main setting of the series, and a school attended by much of the cast. It runs on a trimester system. A student-based music competition known as the Kaimei Rock Festival occurs every year, unless there is a lack of funding and/or entrants.

character.name: Misora Remi
character.description: Misora Remi is a clumsy, often scatter-brained, woman who took over as a teaching assistant at Kaimei High School when Sayama went on maternity leave. She was formerly a host of the educational childrens` show Can Mommy Come Too? and tends to refer to herself as "oneesan." She is currently engaged to Chuu-san. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Yasuda Saori
character.description: Yasuda Saori is a student at Kaimei High School and a member of the Broadcasting Club.

character.name: Izumisawa Yukie
character.description: Izumisawa Yukie is a student at Kaimei High School who Dante likes.

character.name: Takashima Sakiko
character.description: Takashima Sakiko is the manager of Kaimei High School`s baseball team who was blackmailed into smashing classroom windows during the "Glass Man" incident.

character.name: Hiraizumi Eiichi
character.description: Hiraizumi Eiichi is the Kaimei High School baseball club`s reserve pitcher who is questioned as a potential suspect in the "Glass Man" investigation. He appears to be in a relationship with the club`s manager, Sakiko and promised to take her to Koushien. He has very poor aim and silently practices his pitching every morning despite not being a regular on the team. Source: sketdance.wikia.com

character.name: Ozaki Mamoru
character.description: Ozaki Mamoru is the Kaimei High School baseball club`s shortstop who is questioned as a potential suspect in the "Glass Man" investigation. He follows a very precise running course every morning, which coincidentally had him pass through all the buildings that had their windows broken.

character.name: Shimasaki Takao
character.description: Shimasaki Takao is the Kaimei High School baseball club`s fourth batter who is questioned as a potential suspect in the "Glass Man" investigation. He views a bat as a weapon used to take down an enemy, and when swinging has the urge to destroy everything in his path.

character.name: Segawa Fumi
character.description: Segawa Fumi is a first year at Kaimei High School who attends the same Manga Club as Roman. She is good friends with Koma.

character.name: Daimon Akitoshi
character.description: Daimon Akitoshi, more commonly known as Enigman is the head of the Quiz Society.

character.name: Quecchon
character.description: Quecchon is a member of the Quiz Society together with Enigman. Like him, her personality changes when she removes her mask. With it, she has a gentle and obedient personality and dearly loves Enigman, but without it, she has a rude and cruel personality and couldn`t care less about him.

character.name: Kanou Arisa
character.description: Kanou Arisa was Himeko`s first friend in middle school after moving to Tokyo.

character.name: Akina
character.description: Akina is Chiaki`s best friend. She would bring Lucky Drop Candy to school every day, and the pair would each eat one after lunch. Her secret crush on Misato led to an argument, after which she and Chiaki stopped talking to each other and drifted apart. She ended up having to change schools due to her father`s job, but the pair were able to reconcile before she left. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Kakiuchi Jin
character.description: Kakiuchi Jin is a Kaimei High School student who falls in love with Himeko after she saves him from some delinquents. He appears to be friends with Minoru Sakura. Source Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Misato
character.description: Misato is a student at Kaimei High School who was the primary cause for Akina and Chiaki`s falling out, due to the former`s feelings for him. He appears to be a kind, down-to-earth person and ends up urging the girls to reconcile. He is also the one who informs Chiaki that Akina is changing schools. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Tobishima Shou
character.description: Tobishima Shou is a man who worms his way into a lady`s good graces, then sets up his bag to take upskirt footage while on a date with her. Remi falls for his ploy at one point, but is rescued by Chuu-san, who had recognized Tobishima`s name from his last school. After Chuu-san threatens him, he flees. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Mataomi Ai
character.description: Mataomi Ai is a woman who met with J-son in a potential marriage interview. She is so frightened by his actions that she soon flees. She is only named in the anime - the databook refers to her as "Marriage Interview Partner B". Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Chuuma Suzu
character.description: Chuuma Suzu is Chuu-san`s daughter. Her parents are divorced, and her father has said he would only consider getting together with a woman that had Suzu`s approval - which Remi received almost immediately. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Kirishima Ryousuke
character.description: Kirishima Ryousuke is Bossun and Tsubaki`s biological father. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Kirishima Haru
character.description: Kirishima Haru is Bossun and Tsubaki`s biological mother. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Mishima Taisuke
character.description: Mishima Taisuke is a man Bossun meets who is connected to his father`s death. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Tsubaki Ishi
character.description: Doctor Tsubaki is Sasuke Tsubaki`s foster father and the man who delivered Haru`s twins. He was also the one who caused the car accident which ultimately took Haru`s life. He works at the Tsubaki Clinic and adopted Tsubaki primarily at Haru`s behest, as she didn`t want Akane to take on a responsibility she couldn`t handle - namely, raising two babies. On the twins` seventeenth birthday, he tells Tsubaki the entire story and seeks out Bossun to do the same. He is the one who informs each of them that they have a twin. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Agata Saaya
character.description: Agata Saaya is Agata`s younger sister who becomes a Sket Dan regular after her initial appearance. She has a crush on Bossun. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Morishita Koma
character.description: Morishita Koma is a first year student at Kaimei High School and Fumi`s best friend. Her specialty is doing impressions of Sengoku era military commanders. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Uehara
character.description: Uehara is a student at Kaimei High School who once confessed to Koma. According to Switch`s research, he has a reputation of going after any girl with a pretty face. When he witnessed Koma`s incredible strength in action, he quickly decided against dating her. [i] Source: Sket Dance Wikia[/i]

character.name: Yabuta
character.description: Yabuta is a boss of delinquents who go to Tachikawa High School. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Usami Hani
character.description: Usami Hani is a first-year student at Kaimei High School who takes over as Treasurer of the Student Council after Mimori becomes vice-president. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Katou Kiri
character.description: Katou Kiri is a first-year student at Kaimei High School who is descended from real ninja. He becomes the General Affairs Manager for the Student Council after Michiru graduates. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Kuroda
character.description: Kuroda, also known as Rodan is the guitar player for Dante`s visual kei band Jardin. He speaks in a similar fashion to Dante due to the latter`s influence, but is also able to talk normally, much to the relief of the Sket Dan when he comes to them with a request. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Geete
character.description: Geete is the bassist for Dante`s band JardiN.

character.name: Dari
character.description: Dari is the drummer for Dante`s band JardiN. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Kezuka-sensei
character.description: Kezuka-sensei is the advisor for Kaimei High School`s two manga clubs. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Saikawa Nozomu
character.description: Saikawa Nozomu is a student at Kaimei High School and the president of the Boys` Manga Club. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Magata Michinori
character.description: Magata Michinori is a student at Kaimei High School and the vice-president of the Boys` Manga Club. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

character.name: Kutsuwa Daijirou
character.description: Kutsuwa Daijirou is a teacher in Kiri Kato`s middle school who orchestrated the bullying on Kihara and then, Kiri. Source: Sket Dance Wikia

episode.title: 学園のSKET達
The Academy SKETs
Gakuen no SKET-tachi
episode.summary: Teppei just transferred into Kaimei Academy, and he`s pressured to join the Sket-dan by his classmate, Bossun. Then, one day, Teppei is attacked by a mysterious masked paint chucker, "Paint Mask"! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ペパーミント侍
Peppermint Samurai
Peppermint Samurai
episode.summary: Takemitsu Shinzou is obsessed with being a samurai and also captain of the kendo team. But despite his skills, he keeps losing in tournaments. He requests the Sket-dan to figure out why he can`t show his true strength during a match. Can they get results by Shinzou`s next tournament?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 焼却炉の幽霊
The Ghost of the Incinerator
Shougyakuro no Yuurei
episode.summary: Yuuki Reiko, member of the Occult Club, barges into the Sket-dan`s room holding a picture of one of Kaimei Academy`s seven mysteries, the "Ghost of the Incinerator". The Sket-dan are on the case (mainly Switch), trying to find out the truth behind the picture, and getting Shimada Takako from the Newspaper Club mixed up in it, too... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ロマンティック坂の上のファインディングペロリン
Romantic! Finding the Hilltop Pelolin!
Romantic Saka no Ue no Finding Pelolin
episode.summary: Saotome Roman, member of the Manga Club, runs into her "prince" on a hill road on her way back from school in the rain. In order to meet her prince once again, Roman comes to the Sket-dan to ask their help, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝説の鬼姫
The Legendary Onihime
Densetsu no Oni-hime
episode.summary: Himeko was once a delinquent feared far and wide, the legendary yankee Onihime. She`s totally reformed now, but starts to hear odd rumors that "the Onihime has started going on a rampage again." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シューティング ギャングスター他
Shoot Gang Star Etc...
Shooting Gangster Hoka
episode.summary: The second game of the Bibage Battle is a real show between Shinzou and Tsubaki, coming to a truly cinematic finish! Then the curtain rises on a sharp-shooting (or is it, sharp-tongued) battle between Switch and Daisey! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガチンコ・ビバゲー・バトル
Real-deal Bibage Battle
Gachinko Bibage Battle
episode.summary: Yabasawa-san really wants a certain part for her avatar, and asks the Sket-dan to join a game tournament put on by a cellphone game site. The Sket-dan isn`t particularly enthused about the prospect, but when they find out that the Student Council will also be participating... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 見てはいけない
You Mustn`t Watch
Mite wa Ikenai
episode.summary: The Sket-dan is having fun trying to take their minds off the upcoming midterms, when they hear rumors of a mysterious DVD that will curse you with bad luck if you watch it. Just then, Kuramoto Ayumi comes in with a simple request, to help cheer up her friend who has been acting strange lately. But there`s more to this than meets the eye, as the stoic Yagi is acting like someone who has seen something they shouldn`t have... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 円太(えんた)やります!
Enta`ll Do it!
Enta Yarimasu!
episode.summary: Manga artist Hinohara Enta has come to interview students at Kaimei Academy. Bossun thinks he can get popular if he becomes the model for the main character of a manga, but everything he says ends up being way too "boring" and "plain". Then, something completely out-of-the-blue happens! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナーバス & ジェネシス
Nervous & Genesis
Nervous & Genesis
episode.summary: Momoka has come to the Sket-dan for help. It turns out that she`s been asked to audition for a voice role in an anime after being discovered during her performance at the preschool puppet show. Switch leaps at the opportunity to start her harsh training in the way of anime! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夏の桜
Summer Sakura
Natsu no Sakura
episode.summary: Tetsu comes and asks the Sket-dan to meet with someone in his place. It seems like a sickly girl who he was exchanging messages with under a false persona wants to come see him... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鬼姫の目にも涙
Even Onihime Has Tears in Her Eyes
Oni-hime no Me ni mo Namida
episode.summary: Tsubaki from the Student Council tells the Sket-dan they`re going to be disbanded. In order to prove the Sket-dan`s effectiveness, Bossun takes on a request to put on a play for a local preschool. But the Student Council also takes on the same request, and the battle is on! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 内田をプロデュース
Producing Uchida
Uchida o Produce
episode.summary: Uchida Takaaki comes to the Sket Dance with a simple request: make him popular! Bossun and company immediately set their sights on getting Uchida to win a Mr. Popularity contest in their class, but Uchida`s shy personality makes it difficult for him to stand out. Can Sket-dan Productions mold him into a star in just one week?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ピクシーガーデン
Pixie`s Garden
Pixie Garden
episode.summary: It`s the second to last round, and it`s a battle of love between the pitch perfect rich girl and the klutzy, head-in-the-clouds Roman-tic! Which one of the will break their team`s hearts? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スイッチ・オフ
Switch Off
Switch Off
episode.summary: Switch`s "origin story" continues as Sawa-chan goes to young Switch and his older brother for help from a stalker. In a moment of spite stemming from jealousy, though, Kazuyoshi sends Switch and Sawa off on their own to buy personal protection items. While they`re gone, Sawa`s friend Yukino warns Kazuyoshi that the stalker is also a slasher. Kazuyoshi means to go out after his little brother and the girl he loves, but fate intervenes... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 兄・弟
Older Brother, Younger Brother
Ani, Otouto
episode.summary: After helping Yosshi arrange a date, the Sket-dan run into Shinzou arguing with his younger brother. Unlike the proper samurai, his younger brother is rebellious and they don`t seem to get along... The two`s relationship reminds Switch of his own brother and the events of the past... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リトルプリンセスは気分上々
It Feels Great to be a Little Princess!
Little Princess wa Kibun Joujou
episode.summary: Momoka comes to the Sket-dan to ask for help in her voice acting job. In an upcoming episode, she needs to play Liberty Maji back when she was little, and Momoka is having a hard time grasping the mindset of a child for her acting. The Sket-dan try to help by playing children`s games with her, but it isn`t until she and Himeko accidentally drink one of Chuu-san`s drugs that they can really experience their childhood all over again! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ランニングホームラン(改)
In the Park Homerun (Revised)
Running Homerun (Kai)
episode.summary: The principal adores his grandson very much and asks the Sket-dan to prepare a picture play to entertain him. They decide to base the story off of Momotaro, but change things up from the usual... Afterwards, he asks them to play with his grandson for an afternoon, but the kid doesn`t seem interested in having fun at all. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オタクトオカルト
Otaku & Occult
Otaku to Occult
episode.summary: Himeko and Bossun run into each other over the weekend, and notice Switch meeting up with occult-obessed Yuuki... Thinking the two might be secretly dating they follow them, but Switch is actually just helping Yuuki to buy a computer so she can set up her own occult-focused webpage. But when Yuuki runs into an old crush from middle school, will her true colors finally show? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 合コンでツッコんで
Stick it in the Mixer
Goukon de Tsukkonde
episode.summary: Bossun and Himeko get into a little fight, and things are made worse when Bossun and Switch are invited to a mixer with Seiji and three other girls. Bossun is rarin` to impress with his comedic flair, but he`s in for a tough crowd. Without Himeko`s firey comebacks, Bossun`s humor falls flat... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クラブルームと校長室でパニック・イン・髪を切る100の方法
Panic and 100 Haircuts In the Principal`s Office and Clubroom.
Clubroom to Kouchoushitsu de Panic in Kami o Kiru 100 no Houhou
episode.summary: A writer for a local newspaper is coming to interview and take a photo of the Sket-dan, and Himeko demands that Bossun get his hair cut. But when Bossun refuses, Himeko takes things into her own hands... What could possibly go wrong? Afterwards, it`s the principal`s birthday, and the Student Council is planning a surprise party for him. But when the President makes a mess of his prized bronze bust, the principal will be in for a whole different kind of surprise... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: それが男のヒュペリオン
This is How a Man Plays Hyperion
Sore ga Otoko no Hyperion
episode.summary: Yamanobe-sensei is back, and now he`s trying to get everyone in the Sket-dan to play a nutty board game called Hyperion. Everyone except for Himeko, as only men can appreciate this game, supposedly. But the epicness gets Bossun and Switch very enthused about the game, and soon they find themselves heading to the world tournament... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スケッチブック
Sketchbook
Sketchbook
episode.summary: Bossun makes friends with a violinist while practicing for the upcoming Rock Festival, Sugisaki Ayano. He learns from her how fun music is, and in no time the curtain rises on the Kaimei Rock Festival! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カイメイ・ロック・フェスティバル
Kaimei Rock Festival
Kaimei Rock Festival
episode.summary: Kaimei Academy`s music festival is coming up! Bossun is bummed that Himeko and Switch each have joined up with bands to participate. But before long Bossun is invited to join a band and the three are set to compete against each other! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 13日の過ちのエンジェル
Mistaken Angel the 13th
13 Nichi no Ayamachi no Angel
episode.summary: Bossun may have a way with words, but these clients were born with their feet in their mouths! First is J-son-sensei, the shop teacher with the glass heart and looks straight out of some horror movie! Can the Sket-dan help him find love? A man of few words and many offstandish poses, "Dante" perhaps poses the greatest riddle of all... Can the Sket-dan help this Fallen Angel find his Wings? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: SPIRIT DANCE
Spirit Dance
Spirit Dance
episode.summary: The Sket-dan encounter some unexpected guests as the main cast of Gintama shows up in their clubroom unexpectedly. This can only mean one thing: It`s crossover time! Can there really be room in the world for 2 different shows based on Shounen Jump manga airing at 6 PM about a trio of misfits who do odd jobs?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おねえさんとバッド・サイエンティストといっしょ
Together With Onee-san and Bad Scientist
Onee-san to Bad Scientist to Issho
episode.summary: The Sket-dan get a new assistant homeroom teacher (who wants everyone to call her, Onee-san), but she`s a klutz and is upset she can`t be a good role model for the students, so the Sket-dan ask Chuu-san to help with some of his strange drugs. Later, Switch goes through some old inventions of his that didn`t work out as intended... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 武士と服装
Samurai and Clothes
Bushi to Fukusou
episode.summary: Shinzou asks the Sket-dan for help with a makeover to make a good impression when he meets Megumi-dono, a friend he made online, in person. But is Shinzou in modern clothes even Shinzou anymore? Can Shinzou somehow rectify his samurai beliefs with modern garb? Later, Himeko tries a new workout video, but it doesn`t "work out"... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガチャガチャしたにょら☆
Turn the Crank-nyora!
Gachagacha Shitanyora
episode.summary: The Sket-dan gets obsessed with collection a full set of "Super Slim-Figured Slenders" gatcha figures... Next, Momoka`s seems to have fame and moe get to her head. Can her friends get back the real Momoka? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 過ちのエンジェル再臨
The Second Coming of the Mistaken Angel
Ayamachi no Angel Sairin
episode.summary: Dante is back, and this time he`s missing something from his pencil... But could he have a crush on someone? Plus, Bossun and the gang discover another of Captain`s amazing talents, and try and put it to good use, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 榛葉道流のエレガントクッキング
Shinba Michiru`s Elegant Cooking
Shinba Michiru no Elegant Cooking
episode.summary: The Student Council steals the spotlight in this episode! When the Broadcasting Club begins a weekly televised talk show, their first guest is charismatic Student Council member Shinba Michiru. The idea is for him to lead a cooking segment, but the show becomes chaotic due to Shinba`s less-than-helpful assistants, the manipulative Agata and moody Daisey. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヌスット・ダンス他
Thief Dance, Plus
Nusutto, Dance Hoka
episode.summary: he ninja squad Thief-dan is sent on a mission to go rescue Chuu-san`s captured daughter! Then Rocket Dance blasts off into outerspace! Is there anywhere the Sket-dan can`t go?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クイズ戦士エニグマン
Quiz Warrior Enigman
Quiz Senshi Enigman
episode.summary: The Sket-dan is challenged to a battle of wits by Enigman, the masked President of the Quiz Club (and his lovely assistant Quettion). Later, a drop-dead gorgeous second year comes to the Sket-dan to ask for advice... about love? Can the Sket-dan unravel the enigma of love? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おねえさん研究所Rがんばる!
Onee-san Romantic Laboratory
Onee-san Kenkyuusho R Ganbaru!
episode.summary: Roman`s got a new club member, and she`s gotta show her the basics of shoujo manga! So she decides to draw her own "how to draw manga" guide, with hilarious results! Next, Onee-san is back and clumsier than ever! Is there anything she`s actually good at? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガラス男
The Glass Man
Glass Otoko
episode.summary: The Sket-dan is getting filmed for an in-depth story by the AV Club, and their task is to unravel the mystery of the Glass Man, a case of serial window breakings around school. As the Sket-dan narrows down the suspects, the culprit becomes clear, but could this case be a little bit too easy? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 薫風
Kunpuu, Pleasant Breeze
Kunpuu
episode.summary: Hime goes to a high school far away to escape her violent past, but the rumors of "Onihime" have spread like wildfire. When a newfound friend gets into trouble with small-time Yakuza hoods, will Hime step in at the risk of exposing her old identity? Also: the secret origin of Sket Dance! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: OGRESS
Ogress
Ogress
episode.summary: Himeko breaks her Cyclone while helping a client who was being shaken down for cash from a bully... But when buying a new field hockey stick, she`s reminded of what happened in her past... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: きぐるみぶれいく
Kigurumi Break
Kigurumi Break
episode.summary: The Sket-dan is roped into helping with Onee-san`s ex-kid`s show`s stage performance, but they never would have thought it`d turn into a race against time to bring smiles to children`s faces and prevent severe bodily harm to themselves! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 壊れてしまった特別な...正月
One Broken, Special... New Year`s
Kowarete Shimatta Tokubetsu na... Shougatsu
episode.summary: Yamanobe-sensei is back, and this time he`s brought a vintage game console for Switch to repair. The Sket-dan ends up getting hooked on the one game he owns for it, but something smells fishy about it... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ステイクアウト・ブルース
Stakeout Blues
Stakeout Blues
episode.summary: Kids are getting shaken down around school, and there`s only one group to call! The Sket-dan! The Student Council! Wait, both?! Can Bossun and Tsubaki stop hating each other`s guts for long enough to catch the bad guy? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: VS生徒会! バトルQを杞憂する稀有な男
Vs. Student Council! The Rare Man Who Needlessly Fears the Battle Q!
VS Seitokai! Battle Q o Kiyuu Suru Keu na Otoko
episode.summary: Enigman and Quettion are back, and their next victims are the Student Council! With the super-genius Agata stuck in a staff meeting, can the other Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: やにわにモモカ舞台女優への道
Momoka`s Sudden Road to Stage Actress
Yaniwa ni Momoka Butai Joyuu e no Michi
episode.summary: Momoka is the lead actress of a stage play, but she`s having trouble with the bland script. Can the Sket-dan teach her how to spice it up?! And then another Sket friend has a success story: Roman, who`s just made her manga debut! She shows her story to the Sket members, but will Himeko be able to keep from trashing it?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハズカシガール
Bashful Girl
Hazukashi Girl
episode.summary: Himeko saves a first-year student, Jin, from some punks, and he falls head over heels for her. In order to get him to stop hounding her, Himeko tells Jin that she`s already got a boyfriend... Bossun! Now all she has to do is prove it to him... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Happy Birthday 前編
Happy Birthday Part 1
Happy Birthday Zenpen
episode.summary: One day, Bossun discovers a box of video tapes in his mother`s room. The videos show his young mother, a pretty woman named Haru, and a man who looks just like him... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ひそひそおねえさんインストラクソン
Whispering Onee-san`s Instruct-son
Hisohiso Onee-san Instruct-son
episode.summary: J-son-sensei has another meeting with a prospective marriage partner, but this time the Sket-dan has a plan! Meanwhile, Onee-san is also asked out on a date! Everything goes completely smoothly with no mistakes or mishaps at all this week on Sket Dance!

episode.title: ドロップ
Drops
Drop
episode.summary: Captain comes to the Sket-dan with another request: Search for a can of candy drops that was thrown into the bushes. The Sket-dan does everything they can to help her find it, but what`s so important about some can of candy, anyway? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Happy Rebirthday
Happy Rebirthday
Happy Rebirthday
episode.summary: It`s the Kaimei School Festival, and Bossun`s class is doing a maid cafe. Everybody`s parents show up, and Bossun is approached by a man who claims to be the doctor who delivered him. He has finally decided to tell Bossun the truth of what happened that day, which he has kept secret for 17 years... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Happy Birthday 後編
Happy Birthday Part 2
Happy Birthday Kouhen
episode.summary: On Bossun`s 15th birthday, he finds out the truth about his parents. Unable to cope with the tragedy, he lashes out, only to meet the child his father once saved when he was a kid, all grown up, who gives him a letter... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 会えて嬉しい
Happy to Meet You
Aete Ureshii
episode.summary: First, Bossun and Tsubaki partner up for the first time to work on a project, but together, this brother duo is highly combustible! Later on, Tsubaki meets Bossun`s family and has the chance to see his real parents for the first time... but does he want to? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: なんでもやりまっせご主人様
I`ll Do Anything, Master
Nandemo Yarimasse Goshujin-sama
episode.summary: After a bit of horsing around, Himeko accidentally breaks Bossun`s fingers and wrist. To pay him back Bossun makes Himeko sign a contract making her his servant! But having Himeko as a maid isn`t all it`s cracked up to be. Meanwhile, Jin is back trying to woo Himeko, but when he comes to observe the Sket-dan`s activities, all he can see is a loving, bickering couple! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジェネシス・ワールド・グランプリ
Genesis World Grand Prix
Genesis World Grand Prix
episode.summary: Countries from around the world gather together once every four years to celebrate the most ancient of traditions, the pinnacle of sports! Testing their own passion and training against the best the world has to offer, the Sket-dan goes forth, with the pride of their country on the line! Will the goddess of victory shine down on our heroes? Will they be able to claim that yes, they are the winners of the Genesis World Grand Prix?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 顔で笑って心でおり神と呼ばれた男
The Man Who Was Called Laughing on the Outside, but Origami on the Inside
Kao de Waratte Kokoro de Origami to Yobareta Otoko
episode.summary: After Bossun drinks another one of Chuu-sensei`s concoctions, his feelings and expressions become mismatched! And then, Bossun becomes an origami master, but can he overcome nervous jitters to win a major contest? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 占い師をやっつけろ
Get the Fortune Teller!
Uranaishi o Yattsukero
episode.summary: When Yuuki falls under the influence of a seemingly scamming celebrity psychic, it`s the Sket-dan to the rescue! But to take down the fraudulent fortune teller, they`ll have to head to her home turf, at a seminar in front of hundreds of true believers! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: コマちゃんに贈る淑やかな曲
A Graceful Melody for Koma-chan
Koma-chan ni Okuru Shitoyaka na Kyoku
episode.summary: The Sket-dan try to help Koma-chan, a huge girl with a tiny voice. Koma-chan wants to find love, but every time she gets nervous, her near-superhuman strength is unleashed, as Bossun learns firsthand! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ツインテールツンデレガール
Twin Tail Tsundere Girl
Twin-tailed Tsundere Girl
episode.summary: The Sket-dan meets Saaya, a first-year student who`s got tsundere troubles. She wants the Sket-dan to help her stop being so snotty around boys and Bossun becomes the test subject! Then, it`s a real hoot as the Sket-dan and Saaya try raising an owl in the clubroom! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ストップ! 透明人間くん
Stop! Invisible Man-kun
Stop! Toumei Ningen-kun
episode.summary: It`s Mad Scientist Week as another faux-cola potion turns Bossun invisible and then later, Bossun puts on an artificially intelligent "power suit" created by Switch... But the suit soon develops a will of its own! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ユーガッタメール!
You Got Mail
You Got Mail!
episode.summary: Bossun has a new e-mail friend, as does Himeko... In fact, they both start to fall for their respective pseudonymous pal, unaware of the person`s true identity! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 楽屋に行っていいかい?
May I Come Backstage?
Gakuya ni Itte Iikai ?
episode.summary: When Switch`s laptop is on the fritz, he`s left speechless. Can Switch finagle a backstage pass to Momoka`s concert and be his usually suave self when he`s only got a sketchbook to work with? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Skip!
Skip!
Skip!
episode.summary: The students of Kaimei High are going on a class trip, but first, they have to participate in a rope skipping competition to see which class gets the best rooms. Saaya doesn`t have an athletic bone in her body, so is worried she`s going to doom her class to the worst rooms of all, until the Sket-dan tries teaching her how to skip! Then, the students are on their way, but in the back of one bus, Chuu-sensei is playing mad scientist again, and this time his victims are Bossun, Himeko, and Tsubaki! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 漫画乙女は荒野を目指して会議する.
The Manga Girl Aims for the Wilderness and Has a Meeting
Manga Otome wa Kouya o Mezashite Kaigi Suru.
episode.summary: Fumi-chan is a great artist, but what will happen when she tries to emulate Roman`s style of manga?! And speaking of emulate, when Tsubaki temporarily loses his vision, the Sket-dan plays a prank on him by pretending to be the other members of Student Council... but then they`re stuck in the situation! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 進め! 集中力を高め, みんなで協力し合うペロキャンガール勉強会
Go Forth! Everyone Concentrate and Cooperate at the Pelocan Girl Study Group
Susume! Shuuchuuryoku o Takame, Minna de Kyouryoku Shiau Pelocan Girl Benkyoukai
episode.summary: Himeko becomes the new Pelocan campaign girl for a TV commercial, but her sudden stage fright threatens to derail the whole thing! Then, when the Sket-dan is unprepared for the following day`s practice exams, they go to Himeko`s house to study. Featuring Himeko`s mom, the Legendary Oniyome! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 椿と雛菊
Tsubaki and Daisey
Tsubaki to Hinagiku
episode.summary: When Daisey runs afoul of the leader of a group of delinquents who threatens to trash Kaimei High unless she becomes his woman, Tsubaki takes it upon himself to avenge her honor and set things to rights! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 修学旅行狂詩曲(スクールトリップラプソディー) 前編
School Rhapsody, Part 1
School Trip Rhapsody Zenpen
episode.summary: Bossun and Himeko`s personalities are still switched on the school ski trip, so imagine the complications when it`s time to change clothes or take a bath! And complicating matters is Saaya, who has a crush on Bossun but doesn`t know that he`s effectively Himeko right now! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 修学旅行狂詩曲(スクールトリップラプソディー) 後編
School Rhapsody, Part 2
School Trip Rhapsody Kouhen
